question:
When is the World Day for Cultural Diversity for Dialogue and Development celebrated 
every year?
explanation:
The United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) adopted the ‘Universal Declaration on Cultural Diversity’ in 2001 and in December 2002, the UN General Assembly declared May 21 to be the World Day for Cultural Diversity for Dialogue and Development.
The UNESCO is working to promote access to culture, as a part of its #ShareOurHeritage campaign. It has also launched an interactive online exhibition featuring World Heritage properties from across the globe, with the support of Google Arts & Culture.
